Summary Heading: Charming cottage on flower filled patio
Summary: The cottage was charming and comfortable the kitchen was well equipped for making breakfast or lunch. The courtyard with a wishing well was filled with flowers. Only drawback was the steep steps that led to the cottages. The staff responded quickly to our requests

Summary Heading: Wonderful get away to another time!
Summary: We loved staying in our little cottage, in the heart of Laguna Beach. The location is wonderful, the property was clean and beautiful. All the little details in the cottage to ensure the historical elements is so amazing. The bed was also comfy, and we loved sitting out on our own private patio in the afternoon to read. This is a true hidden gem in a place with INSANE nightly rates for hotels and resorts. This was better then staying at a resort in my opinion - we saved A LOT of $$, but also having the flexiblity to make our own meals if we wanted to was great, and having a fireplace in the living room was also a plus. Wonderful stay, we will definitely be back!

We missed our first night because of bad weather, arrived the following day. The outdoors were very pretty. However, when we opened the door, there was a stagnant smell, like it hasn't been aired out in a long time. The smell of old furniture. It was very unpleasant.  We tried to air it out but that didn't help. I think the cottages need some serious overhaul. When it is stated that "the cottages capture the original charm", to me it seemed that they were just old buildings with old furniture.  Many people might enjoy this kind of "charm", judging by so many positive reviews,  but to us it was very unpleasant, so much so, that we didn't even stay the second night and drove home in the rain.

Lovely cottages in a beautiful and quiet setting.  We loved our stay in the Blue Cottage. My favorite  things about the cottage were the comfort, the clean fresh sheets and towels , and the helpful employees. I had a bit of trouble with the steep stairs from the parking lot to the cottage, but I am 80 years old. Would love to stay again in this beautiful location.
Room tip: All 4 cottages are about the same. Choose the color you like.

Summary: Absolutely gorgeous, like stepping into a collection of fairytale cottages! Immaculate, very comfortable, well stocked kitchen, fully fenced and a very large laundry room rounded out the amenities, plus a communal grill and private BBQ. All within walking distance of downtown Laguna and the beach. Perfect!

Cottage is very nice, great location, easy to walk to the beach, only a few blocks away but up hill on return. Only a few small things I wish the unit provided: basic kitchen salt/pepper, pam spray, sponge for cleaning dishes, kitchen towels, oven mit. Bathroom needs larger shampoo/conditioner containers. Checking out details should also be provided. Overall it was great, clean and quiet. Parking on the hill was weird but Saturday we parked in back parking lot.
Room tip: We stayed in the Red cottage.

Summary: This property is well hidden behind ornate wooden doors - you'd miss it if you didn't know where to look.  We loved staying in the Green Cottage - the cottages are adorable and provide way more space than a hotel room.  We enjoyed having the living room as well as the kitchen (two burners, microwave and toaster oven plus full-size refrigerator - not a "full" kitchen in the American style but plenty adequate for simple meals and adequately stocked with dishes, pots/pans and utensils).  The Green cottage has an especially big and very private patio, including gas grill.  Great shower, hot water, and water pressure.  We found the cottage to be very clean and comfortable in every way - including heat, (a.c. available, not that we needed it in April),  ceiling fans, fans, extra

Our studio apartment was compact but well-furnished and comfortable. A brick-lined walkway led past lush plantings of cacti and flowers through an upper courtyard— and then to a private lower courtyard with Adirondack  chairs, loungers, and a barbecue, all on a well-trimmed lawn. A hidden, "secret garden" style gate led out toward the street and then a few minutes' walk to the beach or downtown. All in all, a very quiet, pretty, and relaxing place.

Summary Heading: A beautiful  property in slow decline
Summary: This was our fourth visit over the past six years.  We still love this place, but sadly, our favorite Blue Cottage is falling into disrepair.  Sections of plaster are starting to pull away from the walls and ceilings.  There was no protective fireplace screen.  A large picture that was hanging in the bedroom was missing, revealing only a couple screws and the dusty outline of the frame.  There was only one hanger in the closet.  Alarmingly, the electrical outlet behind the bed was completely exposed from the boxspring repeatedly smashing into the protruding plugs.  In the properties defense, this was immediately corrected upon my request with a new wall plate and an extension cord with a 90-degree bend.  It is clear however, that this repair was not completed by a licensed

We arrived at the Red Cottage and found the door combination did not work.  Txt and Voice Messages sent to the manager went unanswered.  We found a way in to the cottage, finally, and txt'd the manager to call us in the morning to resolve the entry malfunction.  No call - no txt - no contact.  The door combination worked the next day, but the night before was extremely trying and frustrating.  No response from the manager - at all.

We loved this spot for our week visiting family in the area.  Neil was very responsive if anything was needed.  It is a great option if you appreciate having a kitchen and separate living area.  It is also quite an experience to stay in a historic and charming cottage.   The location is just off the crowded area, but still a very close walk to downtown and the beaches.  We will be back!

I stayed a week in the Blue Cottage as a solo traveler and it was a perfect stay. There were so many details that I loved about staying here-  the huge outdoor space and the beautiful flowers and fountain, the comfortable bed, and the easy to work fireplace (perfect for California nights). I particularly enjoying opening the huge windows which made the space feel very indoor/outdoor. Owner was very communicative, parking was easy, tons of comfy towels for the bath and beach. Very safe and quiet location, right by Laguna High School. Would love to stay here again!

Wonderful get away in the middle of the pandemic. Private and quaint. All you need  is provided. Including parking. Buy groceries and stay put or its an easy walk to town or the beach (uphill coming back to the cottage). Bring your own beach gear (chairs, towels, etc). Secure gate codes for check in. Would definitely book again.

We are sad to have to share that Manzanita cottages has gone downhill since our past visits. Mold all over the bathroom ceilings, holes in the wood floors, door handles coming unattached — and a live mouse showed up in the kitchen! ( photos attached of all, except the mouse who quickly ran back into the recesses of a cabinet space). The great reviews from years past were under previous management when we visited back in 2016 and 2018 the property was wonderfully cared for and a pure delight to visit. In fact, we considered the cottages to be one of our most beloved getaways until this recent stay. As a reviewer in Nov of 2019 mentioned, the cottage has not been taken care of as it once was since a bigger hotel company bought the property.  We truly hope they will come to their

These cottages are so adorable - quaint and charming in a quiet neighborhood. We stayed in the Yellow Cottage and enjoyed the private patio for a morning workout and afternoon reading hangout. The location is within walking distance to the beach and lots of shopping and restaurants. Loved our stay!

We stayed 4 days and was a delight. We would go back. Best Shower i have ever experienced. Very clean and soft pillows. Laundry great, Easy walking to beach and a beautiful sunset. Shopping and many great restaurants. beach.

Fun, well maintained cottages conveniently located within walking distance of many food and service options. Cottages/studio are nicely appointed with kitchenettes and have pretty much everything you need to prepare a simple meal.   Stayed here while attending the Pageant which is about a 15 minute walk away.   Small lapses in attention to detail. The studio kitchen had only one coffee cup and wine glass, and did not have a welcome binder. No biggie, just a comment.   Management very responsive via text.   Pricing on the high side for our accommodation budget but worth it considering the fun factor.

A wonderful place to stay, great location for walking into town or the beach. The cottages are roomy and very comfortable. This is our third visit and it will not be our last. We have stayed in the Blue and yellow cottages as well as the studio and all three have been delightful, though our favorite is the blue cottage. The grounds are beautiful with lent of outdoor furniture and tables for outdoor use. The staff is very welcoming and very helpful. We do a lot of traveling and visit and  Manzanita Cottages is one of our favorite places to stay.

I went back and forth deciding if I should post this, but since I've left 2 FIVE star reviews in the past I need to.  EXTREMELY disappointed in the blue cottage this trip.  Walls with patched up paint, broken blinds dirty curtain in the living room, ceiling peeling, a hole in the bedroom wall where a curtain rod was misplaced.  Even their upgraded bedding was gone.  I took pictures and send them to the property manager.  We have stayed here for many years and feel SAD seeing how rundown the property has become.  The attention to detail is no longer there.  After so many years we won't be going back.  The property not worth the current price point.  So very very disappointed.

quiet group of cottages, with private deck and garden for each cottage, fireplace, BBQ, and privacy were super. Short walk to the beach and shopping. Short walk to Ralphs grocery store. Will definitely stay here again.

Laguna Beach has always had a certain aura, a feel to it, that is charming and unique.  The many Arts and Crafts bungalows and cottages that dot the neighborhoods of Laguna are part of its charm, and the Manzanita Cottages embody this pleasing, old fashioned beach town spirit.   Built in traditional old Southern California fashion around a central well, now a fountain, the cottages are perfect examples of Arts and Crafts architecture, with many lovely small architectural details.  I stayed in the beautiful Red Cottage.  It was clean, well-decorated in a way that did not detract from the early 20th Century style of the building, and very quiet at night.  The pretty and well kept little garden and fountain were lovely surprises.  At night, I could hear the waves crashing during

We spent a four days at the Manzanita Cottages in Laguna Beach.  We were staying in the Yellow Cottage.  We loved the place - no disappointments at all.  The bathroom is quite small so if you expect or need a large modern one, this is not the place for you.  BUT if you love vintage and a taste of old California, then I recommend staying there.  We enjoyed sitting out in the garden on a sunny morning having coffee or with a glass of wine in the late afternoon.  We were able to walk everywhere in town.  The bed and furnishings were quite comfortable.  We will be back soon.

I did not stay at this hotel. I called and wanted to make a reservation. My only question was if they had air conditioning as this is very important to me in July. I was told that they have some portable air coolers. I asked what that was? She was entirely rude to me and in a tone that indicated I was annoying the hell out of her, she said I should go somewhere else! No explanation, No apologetic attitude, just ‘You should go somewhere else’! I was astonished. I didn’t deserve, nor appreciate the rudeness of attitude. Although they look quaint, I will stay away. Attitude is everything.

We met some friends here for the third time.  The location is great and most everything is in walking distance.  We love the courtyard and sat outside there in the morning and happy hour time with our friends.  The blue cottage has a lovely private patio but the communal patio/grill area is also quite nice  and secluded.  The air conditioning was SO appreciated this visit because of the weather. Very clean and comfortable bed. We will definitely be back again!

Summary Heading: Fourth time back to the Cottages
Summary: We love coming to the Cottages because they are truly unique and the location is great to walk (uphill coming home!) to most things we like to do (restaurants, beach, shopping, the Pageant). A BIG plus this year was the AC units! Game changer during the heat wave in the West. We have stayed in the Studio, Red Cottage and now the Yellow Cottage. We liked them all. We did discover that the Green and Blue cottages have a grill on their private porches. You can also get a glimpse of the ocean from the Blue and Green cottages as we had friends staying in the Green. The Green and Yellow share a common yard/sitting area so that was perfect to gather with our friends.  The kitchen was somewhat lacking in dishes/prepware but we ate out mostly so we made do. Once again, Manzanita Cottages

Summary Heading: Quaint cottages perfect for a family with small kids. Or a romantic getaway if you remember what that's like.
Summary: A little more than a mile up the hill from downtown Laguna you'll find 4 little cottages in a gated compound. They are older but well maintained, plenty of space for a family with 2 small children. Beautiful and cozy common areas. With chairs for lounging and reading, you might occasionally see a neighbor pass by. It appeared all units had private patios. Stayed in the green door cottage.  The kitchen was functional with gas burners. Fridge, microwave, large countertop toaster oven. Not a spot for cooking big dinners, but great for knocking out a solid breakfast or something not over-involved. Perfect for us with younger kids. Breakfast in the cottage, lunch out and about and dinner with local relatives.   Responsive host. Access to extra blankets, linens on site if needed.

Manzanita Cottages allows you to experience Laguna Beach as a local. These charming cottages provide peace and quiet, but have easy access to the beach. Enjoy life in Laguna like the movie stars of the 1930s and 1940s for whom the cottages were built as a retreat. My husband and I have been enjoying Manzanita Cottages since 2003 and plan many more return visits.

My partner and I stayed two nights in the Green Cottage, and loved the character and charm of the cottage and the small complex of similar cottages. Manzanita is centrally located near restaurants, and the Whole Foods Market within walking distance allowed us to have breakfasts in and snacks with evening cocktails. Unfortunately the weather was cold and rainy so we didn't take advantage of the private patio, but the fireplace kept us cosy and dry. The bed was quite comfortable and the place spotlessly clean. Plenty of hot water and a good shower in the ensuite small bathroom. The vibrant flowers from the steep stepped entry to the cottage were beautiful. Great choice for a long weekend!

I loved staying here. For myself, this space was the highlight of my trip. I would have been content to stay by the wishing well all day.  We also met a wonderful neighbor staying in the "Green" cottage!

Summary Heading: Charming cottages that continue to get better
Summary: My wife and I love the Cottages.  We have stayed here 3 times over the last 2 years and each time has been better than the last.  Recently, they put in a new AC/heat unit.  We used the AC when we stayed in October and had unexpectedly warm weather and the heat when we stayed in December - both worked well and are a significant improvement over the old system.  A few observations: - we have stayed in Red and Green and they're basically the same - the bed is king size and very comfortable - the bathroom is small but clean and has great water pressure - the premises are impeccably maintained; there's a great courtyard and a shared lawn with a grill and chairs - the unit is big enough to sleep 4 comfortably, but the whole point is for a romantic getaway - the gas fireplace works

I’m back to give my honest review of the cottages I have frequented several summers since 2012. My first question is what happened? I adored the charm and small personal touches such as fresh cut flowers and chocolates waiting for you as you walked through the front door. We booked a different cottage this time around. They had installed a key pad which was new .. ok. We walked in and were suddenly hit with a pungent odor of cat or dog urine. We did call about it and manager was apologetic and said they would send someone out to re -clean. We ended up just placing throw rug outside. The flowers were not fresh, wilted actually and water looked murky..and no chocolates :( .. This kitchen didn’t seem as well equipped as the other cottages. The grounds were maintained but didn’t
Manager Response: Hi PinkKimono13.  I'm sorry to hear you did not enjoy your last stay as much as you have in the past. The property owner has invested a lot of time, money, and energy into the cottages over the last year to provide a great vacation experience to guests. We have installed electronic locks not only for the security of the property but also for the convenience of guests. There are also new built in heaters and air conditioners for the comfort of guests. I apologize your rug smelled, we frequently have all the rugs and furniture cleaned and will increase the frequency of it now. At certain times of the year fresh cut flowers are put inside the cottages for fun when the flowers are abundant. Seasonally our garden changes and adapts. In the winter the garden is still beautiful but perhaps less impressive than in the summer. Please reach out to us in the future if you wish to stay again. I will make sure we have fresh flowers and chocolates waiting for you!  Neil

Summary: Came for a mid-week get-away right before Thanksgiving and stayed at the green cottage with my teenage son.  We could not have picked a more charming place to stay.  The cottage was well equipped and the king size bed very comfortable.  The grounds were lovely and the location was very convenient.  All codes and information were provided in advance with no issues.  I plan to return often, it was a great escape from the bustle of Los Angeles.

Summary Heading: Great gardens, great cottage, great location!
Summary: Very clean and perfect for a weekend or a week stay. Close walk downhill to beach and downtown is very convenient. Well equipped, small kitchen. Nice private patio to enjoy your sunny afternoons, and a large garden area for BBQ.

We wanted to stop off on our california road trip at the last minute, and this was the only place we could find available over memorial holiday weekend in the Laguna Beach area.  We were dealt with quickly over chat and sorted out a price and time to arrive, all very straight forward.   When you arrive it doesn't quite look as you might think, you park outside wooden garages, one of which is broken, and it's not a great first impression. We did think we had made the wrong choice.  But once  through the gate and down the steps into the courtyard it opens up into 4 small detached houses around a central garden area, all very neat.  You need to make sure that you read the house guide you get sent, it contains all the codes you need to get in (there are no keys) and which colour you

Lovely place.  Very clean and perfect for a getaway.  Walk downhill is great to beach. Well equipped. Nice private patio to enjoy your breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.  The only problem was check in. There is no on-premise manager or lobby. We weren't given the codes for entry ahead of time and had to wait on the street (after a long drive) for a half hour waiting for a return call. Parking is on a steep slope and a large car might have an issue

Everything was clean, cozy and well appointed with all the necessities.  Comfortable bed, cute private patio.  Small kitchen but everything you need for small group.  Would definitely stay again. Loved it!

If you want a peaceful stay and quality, this is your home away from home.  You will absolutely love this property.  Extremely quite location, walking distance to the beach and downtown.  I highly recommend this place for a getaway to Laguna Beach.

One of the charms of Laguna Beach is the draw of its past as an artists colony.  Manzanita cottages transports you to that time.  Absolutely charming.  The cottages are beautiful and secluded so you feel removed from the noise and clutter of the present.  But all the comforts of the present are there...wifi, tv, coffee, comfortable beds.  All this walking distance from town! Wonderful.

Went with friends (husband and wife) and used sofa bed in living room.  Since only bathroom was off their bedroom it was a bit awkward, but we managed.  Yellow cottage has several stairs and no railing and I'm due for a total knee replacement, so those, and the steep steps leading down from the street parking area were difficult, but we used the high school parking lot after that and it was much easier.  The blue cottage has no stairs, so will rent that next time.  Fresh flowers, charming decor, nice shower and proximity to town made this a place I'll come back to for sure.

The cottages are awesome!! Cute rooms, perfect amount of space. The kitchen is handy to have. Was very quiet. Located driving distance to the beach and all the local shops and food.  there is great out door space to sit and read or just relax. They also have all the towels, chairs etc you may need.

Summary Heading: Quaint and quiet for a weekend getaway
Summary: I recently stayed in the 1-bedroom green cottage that included a luxurious king size bed plus a sleeper sofa.  The kitchenette was the perfect size and we loved having our own veranda to enjoy each morning and/or evening. The cottage was well-equipped and very clean.  We even had our own Wi-Fi. The bathroom was small, but the shower was nice and roomy!  It was just a short walk to shops and restaurants and it was nice not having to drive just to get to the beach.  These very reasonably priced cottages are a hidden gem in the lovely town of Laguna Beach!  A must-stay!

Summary Heading: STILL our favorite place after so many years...
Summary: It's been years now and this is still the place we want to be.  We've stayed in the blue cottage, the red cottage, the green cottage - it doesn't matter.  We are in love with this place.  Short walk down one hill to the beach, short walk down the other to the village.  We have everything we need, including a killer shower and a full size fridge, all pristine.  AND it's perfectly decorated.  We use the lower yard regularly and love the private nature of staying in a residential area.  Chairs, umbrellas, beach towels, laundry and every amenity you can think of is there.  Special kudos to the property manager - Diane ALWAYS makes sure our stay is perfect.  We love her.  LOVE Manzanita Cottages.  It's dreamy!

I enjoyed 4 nights in the yellow cottage. It was super quite and lovely in the inner sanctuary of the garden. All the cottages face this garden with lots of clustered chairs and tables. It was such a respite from the crazy busy aspects of Orange County and I'm thankful that I chose this place. The cottages are within easy walking distance of the town and beach. The bedroom is really quiet and faces its own little patio. The living room would be a great hangout in the cooler months since they have fireplaces and TV to watch movies. I plan to stay here again whenever I go to Laguna. Oh, the other guests are fun and nice; it's easy to make friends!

First it's like stepping back in time, in the very best way. We stayed in the blue cottage for five nights and it was absolutely lovely. The cottage was so sweet with everything we needed and plenty of room. The decor is so perfect that it was the only time during our California vacation that I fantasized on moving there. The patio and garden was a welcome refuge from the busy streets and beaches. My favorite memory is sitting and drinking coffee at the kitchen table and watching hummingbirds fly to the flowering vine that draped across the window and feed. I agree with other reviewers, magical.

We stayed in the Red cottage and it was beautiful.  Roomy, great furnishings, comfortable bed,  and a fully stocked kitchen. Really quiet, and a 10 minute walk to Main Beach. Only caveat: no A/C.  Lots of windows and the nights were very cool and comfortable.

What a pleasant surprise in our busy world!  My daughter and I stayed only two nights in the green cottage and wished it could have been more.  From the beautiful flowers that greet you when you arrive in the courtyard  (there were even fresh flowers on one of the tables inside) to the tasteful furnishings inside which were reminiscent of days gone by, everything was a delight to the senses.  The only reason I did't give 5 stars was that the entrance steps from parking were a little challenging with two large suitcases.  (My daughter was attending a conference in San Diego later in the week so we had to pack for several days.) It would be nice if a ramp of some sort were available or a back entrance where you didn't have to maneuver the many steps.  In spite of this we loved our

What a wonderful property.  We stayed in the Studio Apartment and could not have been happier.  The communication and reservation was made effortlessly with Diane.  The apartment was so cozy and great! We enjoyed every minute of it.  We walked everywhere.  Did not need to use the car at all.  The room, bed, internet, little gift basket with coffee, tea, popcorn, everything was perfect.  The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained.  My only complaint is that we had to leave! I agree with earlier reviewer, you really don't want to tell anybody about this great property! We will definitely be back.  Already looking at dates to book again.  Thank you Diane and everyone else.  We absolutely loved it!

Summary Heading: Best vacation my husband and I have ever had.
Summary: We stayed  in the blue cottage for 10 days. The cottage is tastefully decorated  and comfortable.  The private patio is perfect for morning coffee.  We used the communal patio for entertainment when we had company.  I highly recommend this secluded little grouping of cottages.  It is really a lovely place.

This is the most romantic hideaway we have ever found.  Spacious individual cottages, complete with large living room and wonderful king size master bedroom.  Did I mention the 1930 original gas fireplace??? Huge Windows and French doors that lead to a private little court yard for morning coffee. Fluffy comforters and pillows. All of it surrounded by beautiful flowe gardens. Maybe I should delete this review so I can still get in here once in a while?????
Manager Response: Thank you, Fred. Maybe you could just tell a couple of your friends...? The cottages were actually built in 1927, and yes, all the fireplaces work really well! I hope to see you again.  After all...you still have 3 other cottages to try out! Diane Schnitzer Manager

Summary: My husband and three children stayed in the Red Cottage for our Spring Break family vacation. I was worried as I was going off pictures online and had not seen in person before our arrival. What a pleasant surprise. A very sweet, quiet retreat with so many amenities including beach necessities and cooking supplies and outdoor options. I contacted the Manager Diane prior to check in and she answered immediately and talked through the check in procedure. I emailed the next day to tell her how much my family adores the place and she responded right away. She also checked in during our stay in person and provides helpful tips while visiting Laguna.  The cottages are very secure and the other renters were so friendly and equally impressed. We will make this trip a family tradition.

My sister and I recently spent 2 nights at the Blue Cottage.    We really enjoyed the welcoming goodies left for us as well as the beauiful gardens.  We spent a lot of time in the yard relaxing on the comfortable chairs enjoying our surroundings.  The only negative might be that there are a few steps down to the cottage that would be difficult for handicapped guests.  Otherwise, such a charming, clean place to stay.  We also enjoyed the location,  The cottages are in a residential neighborhood, a quick 10 minute walk to the shops and restaurants.

My husband and I spent 3 days in the Green Cottage.  What a sweet, whimsical place this is.  Like staying at an artist cottage back in the 20's.  Ample supplies - had everything we needed.  It was very HOT though in the cottage when we arrived around 2 in the afternoon- but the weather was abnormally hot and humid.  There were a few fans-  so after an hour or so- blew out a lot of the hot air.  It was much more comfortable by the time we were ready for bed.  Not recommended for handicapped guests- as there are 15 steps down to the property.  All in all- great place to stay if you like to have room to spread out and love to stay in "boutique" type of inns.  So much better than a cookie-cutter hotel and at much more reasonable price!

Our family loved the Manzanita Cottages.  They were a good size for a family of 4, and the kids liked the yard in between the cottages.  The decor was adorable, the bedding comfortable and the location was close to lots of things.  It was REALLY HOT, but I understand the property has finally received permission from the city to install air conditioning!  We think it'd be fun to plan a trip sometime with a few other families so the kids can run around in the yard without us worrying about waking anyone up.  The internet was a bit patchy, but we were on vacation and didn't really care.  The television worked well.  The kitchen had everything we needed.

There are only 5 little cottages at this "hotel."  There is no A/C, but in 90 degree weather, we left the windows open and the fan on and were perfectly comfortable during the heat of the day.  Mornings and evenings were cool.  There are outdoors seating areas, which are neat.  You feel as if you are tucked away from the rest of the world.  Bed was comfortable.  Cottage (we were in the red door) was immaculate.  Pictures on their website are accurate.

Summary Heading: Great cottages and location! Beware however, no A/C!
Summary: The Manzanita Cottages are ideal for a romantic getaway or just some nice quiet time in a comfortable setting. Only drawback is there is no A/C and it gets very hot in the afternoons and early evenings; the management stated to me that they are presenting a request to the City Council for an allowance...so I'd call them to see the status or wait until the hot weather is over.  Otherwise, a great place!

For the 4th of July we went to Laguna and stayed at these wonderful cottages with our furry kids. Great location - just a short walk to the beach and shops. Grounds are beautiful for sitting outside and enjoying the day.

Last weekend, I spent 3 nights in the Red Cottage. I did not feel safe, as the lock on the front door was totally broken! They have a small, old & cheap slide bolt, that a child could break...that is THE SECURITY, on the front door! After complaining to the manager, I was told, "we haven't had any break ins for 15 years"...... Oh, that makes me feel safe.  The lack of air conditioning in this place was appalling! Upon returning late Saturday night, I was hit by a WALL OF HEAT!!!  It felt like an OVEN! They supply 3 dirty & dusty fans, so they MUST realize, the place gets HOT! It was very difficult to sleep, & I kept waking up sweating...  The promise of WiFi was a joke, as it rarely worked. The promise of Cable TV & Netflix, etc.....was totally ridiculous. I finally managed to
Manager Response: As the manager of the Manzanita Cottages, this is very sad to see, and I think it's obvious that it's an anomaly in long list of five star excellent reviews. Sometimes, even though you do all that you can to make your guests happy, it is not to be. It is very hard to help someone with real as well as perceived issues when you are only told of them after they leave, which gives you no chance to assuage heated emotions and to try and solve any kind of issue.  I tried to talk to her when she got home, but that was a wasted effort. The real problem lies in the fact that even after this guest called me prior to booking the cottage, and was told that we do not have air conditioning, but do have 2 ceiling fans and some floor fans, and even after admitting that she was on the fence about coming because of that, shortly after the call she booked anyway. I cannot control the weather, and wouldn't you know...we had a heat wave, and yes...it was humid.  However, there were 8 other guests on the property that weekend who said that they were not miserable and that the fans were adequate. As far as the intermittent cable/WiFi is concerned, I can't try to fix what I don't know about, and if the cable provider was experiencing trouble with their service, at this point I will never know. It is working perfectly, and has been since she left. This guest also said in another email sent directly to me that she was scared because no one was on the property but her, and that the cottage wasn't safe.  As I stated above, she was hardly alone, every door and window locks securely, and we have never experienced any kind of intrusion. This and many other things she stated in that email and in this review are simply false.   In our almost 16 years in business, it has been imperative to work from the premise that this is #! a People business, and I have worked very hard to go the extra mile to make all of our guests happy for 7 of those years. (This guest is only the second one since 2011 where all efforts have failed.)  Nonetheless, this is why we have a very high rate of return guests, and all those five star "excellent" reviews. That is the real Manzanita Cottages.  The one portrayed in this review is unrecognizable.

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay in Orange County
Summary: I've lost track of how many times we've stayed at Manzanita Cottages.  It's the only place for us.  The cottage is maintained perfectly year after year with attention to detail that makes everything so easy.  Diane is there to make sure every detail is taken care of . . . we LOVE her!  A walk to the beach, a walk to the village - a parking space - an adorable bungalow with upgraded linens and all the beach equipment we could ever need.  Add the lush landscaping - it's beautiful.  We only checked out yesterday and we miss it.  Thanks, Diane.  See you in 2016.

We lived in Laguna Beach for over 10 years so we love coming back to visit our favorite restaurants.  The hotels here are SO expensive so we decided to try the Manzanita Cottages which are reasonably priced in comparison.  We stayed in the Blue Cottage and it was lovely.  The cottage size is around 500 square feet with a living room with fireplace, sofa and chair, a small kitchen and eating area,  a nice sized bedroom with king bed and a small bathroom.  The entire cottage has been updated beautifully and is spotlessly clean.  The shower has great water pressure and the bed was extremely comfortable.  Fans in the bedroom and living room help keep the air flowing so air conditioning is not necessary.  The wifi was a little weak depending on where you were in the cottage.  We

This was our second trip to the Manzanita Cottages and I'm sure we'll be back for a third trip. We love this place!! The location, the solitude, the ambiance. Everything. (Well, maybe everything except the pull out sofa-bed ☺.) The patio where we eat our breakfast, listening to the well gurgle at night. It's a great place!!

The Manzanita Cottages were perfect for our two nights in Laguna!  We booked two cottages which fit in perfectly to the essence of Laguna.  They are gorgeous, arty old style Laguna in a quiet neighbourhood just a short walk from city centre and beach with ample parking and well appointed.  All of our party were impressed and plan to come back! Dianne made sure that everything was ready.  All of the support staff were friendly and helpful.  It is nice that it isn't a "hotel" but rather a secret garden in the midst of one the  most special towns in the world.

We stayed in the Studio Unit of the Manzanita Cottages for two nights over a weekend. The unit is clean, cute, well furnished and decorated in a appealing countryesque motif. The cottages are well located with an easy walk to the village (about 7 minutes) in a relatively quiet neighborhood. There are no water view from the units but the grounds are well maintained and the rentals are stocked!  There is free self service laundry and 1 dedicated parking space per unit.  Good wifi, complimentary coffee, tea and water upon arrival with a comfy bed and lots of towels. The only thing we missed having was access to a pool as there is not one on sight.   There was some noise transfer from neighbors and otter units (this seems to be the case whenever there are teens in the picture) but

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for families
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay again this year. Walking distance to the beach and restaurants. The gated property is very private and peaceful with a lovely courtyard. Love the wishing well and all the beautiful plants and fruit trees. Diane is wonderful and helpful with whatever you may need. They have beach chairs, umbrellas and towels available to use. We went with another family so we had two cottages and enjoyed sitting in the courtyard in the evening after kids went to bed. The sofa bed was great for the kids and pretty comfortable.

OMG I loved this place so much!  We stayed in the studio for two nights and aside from no A/C (we live in Atlanta and are accustomed to it) it was perfect. The cottages and grounds are darling. Grocery nearby and overall great location and price. So good!

We recently enjoyed a fabulous weekend at the Blue Cottage and would definitely return! The property is well-appointed and simply charming with classic Laguna Beach decor. Close to the heart of town so we walked everywhere, but know that it's located on a hill so it's a steep walk up and down to Main Beach.

Sooooo lovely! Super clean spacious cottage. Lots of steps and uneven pavement, for some that could be a problem but that's also a big part of it's charm. I stayed in the yellow cottage. The toilet takes forever to fill so we poured water in the tank so we wouldn't have to listen to it. The bed was too hard for me. Some folks may see that as a plus. A mattress topper would have done the trick. And still I loved it here!

We loved this place!  I can't believe we stumbled upon such a gem.  We usually like nice hotels but without the budget to pay for it but we loved this place even better than a hotel.  Our yellow cottage was cozy and comfortable and we loved the sound of the wishing well and the beautiful outdoor scenery too.  Plus with the kitchen we could make breakfast and not have to rush out.  I almost wanted to just stay at the cottage the whole time!  The inside decor was so lovely too complete with fresh flowers on our table.  Plus the bed was SO comfortable which is a must in my sleep deprived mommy state.  And the best part was we never had to get in our car because we could just walk everywhere.  There's also a shared area down below with a BBQ, tables, outdoor couches which is great

We recently stayed in the red cottage and were beyond thrilled we'd stumbled across the Manzanita Cottages! Just enough space for us and our 5 month old daughter - cozy, charming and extremely comfortable. The kitchen had everything you could need, the bathroom was well kept and felt very clean, and the BED. That was the most comfortable bed I think I've ever slept in. I love that unlike a hotel, the sheets and the towels were like ones you'd use at home - soft and fluffy. There was enough room for our daughter's pack and play in the bedroom, and it was so nice having the living room space where my husband and I could hang out in the evenings after she'd gone to bed. And having an actual yard and space outside of the cottage was wonderful, too.  A very quick and easy walk to

What a find!  The Manzanita Cottages are perfect for those who want to stay AWAY from the hustle and bustle of the Coast Highway.  We stayed in the small studio apartment and found it to be just perfect.  Very nicely decorated and just the right size for two.  The walk to the beach and the "main drag" was easy.  We would definitely stay there again.

Our second stay, first in Red Cottage, this time in Green. Green has a very nice private patio but both are very nice.  Easily our favorite place to stay in Laguna.  The words "charming" and "cozy" are greatly overused, but they apply perfectly here.  You'll feel as though you were back in Laguna Beach of the 1950s.  Nicely furnished with eclectic period furniture and with attractive art (albeit reproduced) on the walls.  Not a motel or BnB so don't expect those amenities.  But you'll save a bundle by self-catering. Easy 5 min walk to the center of town and to Main Beach.  Our only major complaint was that the central heat was non-functional.  We had to rely on space heaters.  Had the weather been cooler, this could have been a real minus; as it was, just an annoyance.  Minor

We just stayed at the Manzanita Cottages in the red cottage. What a wonderful relaxing experience.  We stayed three nights from 4/7/15-4/9/15. We wanted to stay some place romantic and relaxing and we got just that. We brought our own food as the kitchen has everything you need to make your own meals, with the exception of an oven. There are extra blankets as well as towels, fan, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and small space heater. We didn't find it to be too cool in the evening in the cottage, but did make use of the fireplace. Great restaurants and shops are within walking distance. The courtyard is beautiful and it was nice to sit and enjoy a glass of wine on the adirondack chairs. There is a small patio in the back of the red cottage that was perfect for having breakfast

Summary Heading: Our 4th stay at our favorite cottages on the west coast
Summary: Time and again these sweet cottages were a place of refuge and relaxation for our family. Recently we stayed while attending a  retreat. Love the kitchen and the ability to cook our own food.The fireplaces are such a cozy touch- i used mine daily.  The grounds are wonderful too! Diane, the manager is always available, professional and a joy to work with.  We will be back soon!

My husband and I stayed in the red cottage.  It was clean and cozy but the interior walls, sofa and fabric chairs were well used.  The bathroom and bedroom were missing window screens. The green and blue cottages are better choices if you want an outside patio space.

My husband and I stayed in the yellow cottage for three nights in February, and I loved every minute of it!  The cottage was cozy and very charming.  The gas fireplace adds to the charm (I was glad the weather was a bit chilly so we could use it!).  The cottage was spotlessly clean and very comfortable and well equipped.  The grounds are also beautifully maintained – we spent a good deal of time enjoying the flower-filled garden, and were visited by a cute hummingbird on several occasions.  This is the perfect place to stay in Laguna Beach, easy access to town and the beach.  I would definitely love to stay here again.

The cottage was delightful and we were thrilled with our stay there.  We stayed in the yellow cottage but any of them would have been fun.  The pictures on tripadvisor intrigued us, but I was still surprised by how charming the cottages really are.    The entire cottage was very clean and comfortable and the kitchen was well equipped.  I enjoyed sitting outside in the sun in the wonderful garden spot. I would love to go back anytime!!   Don't miss this delightful experience!!

My husband and I stayed in the Green Cottage for 4 nights in January. It was the perfect accommodation for us while we explored the Laguna Beach area. The cottage was spotless! I'm pretty fussy when it comes to cleanliness and I could tell that a lot of effort had gone into preparing the cottage for the comfort of its guests. When travelling, I also expect a good sturdy bed and a great shower. The Green Cottage has both. The king-sized bed was very comfortable and the shower very powerful. It's also a bonus having access to the washer and dryer on the premises. We would definitely stay here again!

What a fabulous find! Nestled in the lower hills of Laguna Beach, Manzanita Cottages is an easy walk to almost everything in town, while the location is quiet and peaceful.  Well-equipped, well maintained, clean and super homey and private. Comfy bed and pillows a real plus. Open the windows for lovely breezes and views of surrounding gardens and patios.    I will be back.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Green Cottage. Travelling with our teenage son, we appreciated the extra space and the kitchen. The outside patio was a bonus - perfect for lunch in the sun. Everything was clean and the decor was eclectic and fun.  The manager was very helpful in sending us a left item.  Note that these are cottages, not a hotel, so there's no concierge, etc. However there are all the expected room amenities, maps, and a lot of charm.  Would definitely stay at the Cottages again.

We stay in the Manzanita Cottages every time we go to Orange County. Even after ten visits, we still think the place can't be beat for convenience, service, cleanliness and fun. Having a kitchen, a sweet garden with a grill and a separate but equally welcoming courtyard with wishing well adds to our delight. The perfectly designed nearly identical cottages has a kitchen, dining area, bedroom and spacious living room enhanced by a warming fireplace. Even the tiny studio meets all our travel needs. It is a short walk to the commercial heart of Laguna Beach and to the beach where whales, dolphins, seals and graceful pelicans play in the surf.

We stayed at Manzanita Cottages in late October and we had an amazing time. We rented the studio, which was plenty big for just the two of us. The decoration is very nice, the cottages are exactly the way they look in the pictures on the website. The bed was very big and comfy, the kitchen was equipped with everything we needed to cook (even though most of the time we went out for dinner). The self check-in went smoothly, and even though there was no staff on premise (or because of it) we felt very much at home and welcome. In the middle between the cottages there is a small piece of grass with lounge chairs, where we spend some lazy afternoons with our books in the sun. Behind the cottages is a grill and a few tables, so there is plenty of space to sit outside as well. The

Several years back my mother lived in one of the cottages for a year or so and I have to say, as far as the grounds go and the location, it's perfection.  They are tiny little hidden gems in Laguna.  I would absolutely stay in this hotel if I get the opportunity.

We Stayed in the studio and it was perfect for two. We had a great time!!! We would stay there again.  The room and the grounds were very nicely decorated and the manager was very h elpful with the questions we had. Its a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: We thought we had stepped into a fairy tale
Summary: My wife and stayed here at the end of September 2014 and we are really glad we did. These rather "unLaguna Beach" style properties are delightful and the cottages do have a fairy tale look to them. The manager, Diane allowed us to have a tour around all four cottages and the studio apartment. The cottages are all equally attractive and well appointed having everything you need for a great vacation. That said I would slightly favour the Blue Cottage as it has a very nice private terrace. They also have a laundry room on site, cooler boxes and ice were provided as were beach chairs and towels.  In a great location. A five minute walk downhill to the town centre and beach so it's quiet at night but not far away from the action. Laguna is a great place with some great restaurants,

Summary Heading: Private and Serene: A special place
Summary: My 83 year old mother, my sister and me rented the yellow cottage for a wonderful getaway weekend. The cottage was delightful and it was the end of September so the night breezes were great. Clise drive or walk to the laguna beaches, stores and restaurants. The kitcgen offers coffee and cold water. The property manager is awesome..perfect place for three people. If you have an older person make sure they can manage the stairs or use the alternate entrance with no stairs. Only negative is the lack of storage or shelves in the bathroom. There is no room. They are working on this with the new owners.

Summary Heading: The Green Cottage was Great! We Loved it! Can't Wait To Come Back!
Summary: The location is great, within walking distance to downtown and the beach.  The Green Cottage was clean and comfortable.  It had everything we needed for our stay.  We can not wait to come back and visit. My wife loved the charm of the cottage.  We can not say enough good about our stay at the Cottage.  We strongly suggest this as a great place to stay when visiting Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Historic and Well Decorated Cottages and StudioProper
Summary: I have stayed three times at this historical, cozy and ultra clean property.  I especially love the Studio, but all the cottages have been decorated so tastefully in the 20's style.  I loved the Studio's bathroom, which had bees interspersed throughout the spotless white tile and beautiful white and gold diamond tiles on the floors. The small retro red "Nostalgia" fridge in the kitchen held all my snacks and the french doors opened up the room to a tiny walkway/potted garden to let in the cool ocean breezes when it is warm.  Two strong fans are provided for the afternoons if it is hot, as there is no air conditioning..but it is still comfortable, especially as it cooled down at night and in the mornings.  A wonderful and peaceful stay in Laguna, with a short walk to the village

. . . the mattress had been more comfortable it would've been perfect. It was broken down in the middle, and I threw out my back and ended up laid up indoors for our whole trip, missing the Pageant of the Masters and all of the fun we had planned.  The property absolutely oozes charm and the Green Cottage is a gem. It is perfectly and lovingly restored, and reminded me of my grandma's house, right down to the air-dried fresh-linen smell. The location is perfect--close to the beach and downtown buzz, but far enough to be quiet. And the garden is sooo precious.

I was overdue for a rest, and the Cottages was the best thing for me!  Peaceful, cozy, inviting and a quick walk to the beach or town.  It was perfect!  I loved the 20's décor and the care they took in renovating the property down to every detail.  Diane was a doll, friendly and accommodating, although we never needed to contact her since we had everything we needed.  I can't wait to go again and try each and every cottage.

This establishment is a breath of fresh air in a town that is drowning in excess. The cabins are clean, well located, provide free parking, and are generally comfortable.  These are older buildings with no air conditioning, but the same is true of the Surf and Sand at three times the price.  If Laguna Beach winds your clock, this is worth a try.

Summary Heading: Beautiful location within walking distance of the beach.
Summary: We loved our stay in the adorable quiet cottages. Diane was wonderful on making sure we felt welcome and was available via phone for any concerns which we had none as they had already though of everything. The location is just a few minute walk down to the beach and downtown Laguna but when inside the lush courtyard, it feels like a different world and is great for relaxing after a day at the beach. We were happy to find a playground for the kiddos at the beach as well. Great family vacation! We would definitely like to stay again.

Summary Heading: Awesome, felt like we were in another country
Summary: Great little house/cottage in a quiet neighborhood  - we were in the Green cottage.  The place was great and very clean with a super comfortable bed.  The grounds/patio were great as well.  5-10 minute walk to the beach and town.  Diane was great to work with and very nice.

Summary Heading: Two nights in a world away
Summary: So so pleased I found Manzanita Cottages during our trip from New England to southern California.  Sometimes it makes sense to have the predictable accommodations of a hotel, but for a real sense of a community and vacation, these guest cottages were superb!  Traveling with a teenager and a middle school girl, each of whom love the novelty of being away from home, I was not sure if the homey feel of the cottages would fit.  They LOVED it - the hummingbirds at the window, the incredibly comfortable king sized bed in the Yellow Cottage, the beach supplies, the airy feel throughout.  We have not stopped raving about this choice and you cannot go wrong.  Thanks, Diane, for your care to us and this place!

Fabulous! Manzanita Cottages is a place in which existence is positive, harmonious and eternal. Our whole family found only peace, prosperity, and happiness during our getaway at Manzanita Cottages. We all felt very relaxed and absolutely loved the atmosphere, everything was amazing. It has a little secret garden where my boys had a great time looking for easter eggs, blowing bubbles, playing freesbie, and catch. There are lots of things to do here to keep your day filled or simply lounge to relaxation and peacfulness at its beautiful grounds! It is located at walking distance to everything: Main Beach, Beautiful Park, Galleries, Shops, Restaurants and Bars, Library, Community Pools and Tennis Courts, Grocery Stores, etc. The Main Beach has volleyball courts, basketball courts,

We stayed here in March in the Studio apartment.It had everything we needed and the setting feels like being in a very small village.It is very quiet which we liked but very close to all of the wonderful shops ,restaurants and beech. the walk up and down the hill gave us a nice burst of exercise each day and we would definitely stay here again.

My husband and I spent a delightful 5 days in February at Manzanita Cottages. We were getting away from a very long, cold, East Coast winter.  The green cottage served as an oasis of relaxation and peace.  It was just a short walk to restaurants in town and to the beach. But the best part was staying at the cottage, relaxing in the lovely accommodations, sitting outside and reading in the sunshine.  There were even fresh flowers when we arrived.  Vastly exceeded expectations.

Summary Heading: Our New Home in Laguna -- Incredible
Summary: This could not have been more perfect for us: a few blocks walk to incredible restaurants, 2 grocery stores, great shopping, and the beach! A comfortable miniature house for 2 and the charm of Laguna were better than we had imagined! The cottages were a little haven for us, and we loved our stay. Here's a suggestion: Get an outdoor table at Watermarc in the "alley" across from the chocolate shop and the gelato store. Buy chocolates while your food is cooking and finish with a gelato. Now what could be better?

While looking into places to stay while in Laguna Beach, I stumbled across the Manzanita Cottages online.  This place just looked too unique not to try.  We studied the four different cottages and decided on the Red one.  From the time we arrived, we knew we had made the right decision.  The cottage was so cute and very clean.  We loved having our own little house while there.  So much better than a single room in a hotel...and better priced.  Being able to go and sit in the courtyard near the wishing well...late in the afternoon...with a drink...was wonderful!  The only change I would have made in the cottage was to have all sheets and pillowcases match.  They already had quality towels in the bathrooms and just needed to update the sheets....but the bed was very comfortable.

I'm from Laguna, and this is my favorite place to stay there - it's like a getaway to home; it has the charm and intimacy of the old Laguna. I've stayed there with my wife and two daughters a few times, and just stayed in the cozy studio apartment for the first time last week. Diane is always welcoming, and it's always a pleasure to hang in the courtyard and run into guests, who are always beaming about the charm and character of the cottages, and how convenient it is to walk into town or to the beach. The best.

I recently returned from my first visit to Manzanita Cottages and was thoroughly impressed!  We had three of the cottages and they were all lovely, clean, smelled great. Diane had left flowers, coffee, chocolates, etc. for our arrival. I was there celebrating my sister's birthday with out of town friends and we were all so happy we experienced the cottages.  Sitting in the garden with our coffee in the morning, sipping champagne in the late afternoon...a perfect weekend!!  Can't wait to go back!!

My husband and I recently stayed at the Manzanita Cottages in Laguna Beach.  It was wonderful.  It is located perfectly to walk anywhere in the village.  Only 4-5 blocks from the ocean and great restaurants.  We definitely got all our walking done!   The cottage was clean and welcoming.   We actually came to see the Pageant of the Masters for the second time.  We were not disappointed.  I highly recommend the cottages as a zen place to stay in Laguna, it is beautiful and quiet.  We will be back.

This was our second year to vacation with our whole family in Laguna Beach and our first time staying at the cottages. We had three of the four cottages and loved them. They all have the same floor plan but are decorated differently according to their color. The complex is walled in giving the feeling of a lovely secret garden. It is charming. We walked to the beach every day with the children. The little ones needed to be carried back up the hill but the bigger ones were just fine with the walk. Diane, the manager, came every day to make sure all was going well. We even made good friends with the family in the fourth cottage. Their children were the same age as two of our grandchildren. We are coming back next year for a wonderful stay.

To the previous reviewer who compared this to the Shire- NAILED IT.  1) Location. This little group of cottages are in a GREAT laguna location. A 10 minute walk from downtown Laguna beach (i rented a car and didnt actually need it for half the trip).   2) As much as these cottages are tucked away, literally down a small street across from the high school, I was pleasantly surprised when I opened the front gate. - Dont judge a book by its cover when you drive up initially and park. There were colored cottage doors, kept gardens and lawns, and even a well !  3) I stayed in the single/studio room and it was PERFECT for just me.  I only wished I could have stayed in a cottage. The room was extremely clean, and the attention to detail gave it a lot of character PLUS the bed was very

The Manzanita Cottages are a truly spectacular place to stay when visiting Laguna Beach.  The cottages are ideal for couples wanting a romantic retreat or even a family on vacation. I have stayed in the Red and Yellow cottages and really loved them both. The rooms were immaculate and the beds were very comfortable. Plus it is only a short walk into the heart of Laguna or the pristine beach! I would definitely stay here again!

My wife and I were looking for a quaint getaway for rest. The pictures reminded us of the Shire from Tolkien's Hobbit, which we love. We were not disappointed. Quiet area. Great attention to detail within the cottage and the landscaping. We actually read a bit from The Hobbit in front of the warm fireplace. The layout of the 4 cottages are the same, but we chose the yellow cottage and loved it.   P.S. We were concerned about a couple negative reviews on here about the management and response time. We found that e-mail worked best (info@manzanitacottages.com) and the management was very accommodating. Thanks Manzanita!

Have you dreamed of getting away to your own little cottage to write, paint, dream or just relax? Looking for a romantic getaway? This is the place. I stayed at the Yellow Cottage and loved it!  Sunlight poured through the floor to ceiling windows during the day and the beautiful fireplace kept things cozy at night. Butterflies flit around the gardens and herbs grew just outside the door--which you're encouraged to clip and use for cooking. If you enjoy genuinely old buildings, you'll appreciate the glass doorknobs, original door latches and creaky hardwood floors.  The cottage was very clean and fresh flowers on the table were a lovely greeting. Other good things? A roomy king-sized bed, private patio, a dedicated (free) parking space, beach towels, iron and ironing board,

So glad we chose to stay at Manzanita Cottages for two nights last week. We stayed in the "Green Cottage" - it was immaculate, comfortable and very relaxing.  It was MUCH nicer than staying in a hotel on the PCH.  It's tucked away in a quiet neighborhood a few blocks uphill from the beach and from the restaurants.  It's all very walkable.  I only wish we had more time to spent in the garden.

In reading all of the reviews I noticed most of the stays were during the offseason and the weather is comfortable.  I booked a stay in the Blue Cottage for a week this September.  They look nice and I thought it would be a nice experience in lieu of a hotel.  Being from TX and I have stayed in Laguna Beach before, I was looking forward to a change.  I was not made aware of no AC in the cottages and when we arrived the cottage was so hot that we could  not even remain.  When I contacted the owner, she was rude and told me to go to the beach.  We setup all of fans and stayed for over 6 hours hoping to come back to a cool place.  Even with  the 3 fans and windows opened, still hot and humid.  We had to leave, get a hotel and could not go back.  I am sure this a nice place during
Manager Response: We have a long history of delighting guests.  In fact, we are the highest rated vacation rental property in Laguna Beach, so it's very disturbing to read these distorted comments.  Although she claims that I was rude to her, I never had a conversation with her.  It was quite unfortunate that the guest adopted a hostile attitude from the outset and didn't give us a chance to work out an amicable solution.    A couple of things should be pointed out in our defense.  The national weather service has on record that the average high was 71 degrees during her stay.  Nowhere on our website do we indicate that we have air-conditioning, nor do we show it on the list of amenities on any of the third party travel sites.  Our welcome letter which is sent a few days prior to arrival has a link to the weather forecast for Laguna Beach, so there should be no surprises there.   Finally, the guest did in fact receive a full refund.  Since we didn't promise air conditioning it's hard to argue that we deprived her of a that service.  The guest abruptly vacated the property, took the keys and threatened to hold them hostage until we agreed to provide a refund--not a warm and fuzzy approach to problem solving.  In our twelve years in this business we've never encountered such hostility and obstinacy.  We've advised our fellow lodging establishments to beware of bookings from this guest.

Summary: My wife and I just returned from another amazing stay at the Manzanita Cottages. We visited to celebrate our third wedding anniversary and are never disappointed by the great communication and high level of customer service by Diane the property manager and the owner.  Thank you to the entire Manzanita Cottages Team!  Best Regards,  Christopher, Amy & Charlie

My husband and I found these cottages on trip advisor after deciding last minute to drive to Laguna instead of Monterey Ca. Most of the bigger hotels were booked so I decided to check out other options.. Best decision I made!!! This place was so enchanting and we felt so elated that it was better than imagined! The location is great! You will have a bit of a walk but not far.. Mostly on an incline but after all the eating we did, we were glad we had some exercise! Diane was pleasantly helpful  and we were able to add an extra night last minute ( it was that great) we are definitely  coming back! So happy to give them a review they deserve!   Make sure to try Sirena Grill, walking distance on Mermaid,  Romeo Cucina and House Of Big Fish.. All great places to eat. :-)

We recently stayed in the Red Cottage.  The property manager does an amazing job here! The grounds were perfectly groomed and gorgeous.  The flowers were in bloom and the space was picture perfect.  Just to sit in the outdoor areas with a glass of wine was one of the most relaxing and enjoyable parts of our trip.  The cottage was super clean and charming. The bed was comfortable. It's very conveniently located.  We were able to walk to the beach, shops and restaurants from the cottage. It is cozy. If you are expecting a lot of space, you will be disappointed, but the space is used very nicely.  We had been staying in hotels through our vacation, and we were the most comfortable here.  The place felt huge after staying in hotel rooms. We want to try every cottage, and will be

My husband, son and I stayed in the blue cottage and our daughter and her family stayed in the yellow one. This was the perfect choice for a multi-family vacation, much better than a traditional hotel. Both cottages are beautifully decorated, the beds are super comfortable, and while the kitchens are tiny, they are well stocked with anything you might need. There's also a grill in the lower garden if you want to cook out. The location is excellent, just a short walk to the beach and restaurants. We spent most evenings hanging in the garden, enjoying the beautiful flowers, watching the many hummingbirds, and sipping wine. It was the most relaxing vacation we have had in a long time. Next time we head back to Laguna, we will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Rareness of beauty and quality of service! Customer satisfaction a top priority here!
Summary: My husband and I are planning a trip to Laguna and came across these lovely cottages. I hunted high and low for a good reason not to stay here and I just could not find one. Every review boasts of careful attention to detail, every cottage being clean, comfortable and cozy. The location is great and the price fair, but what sold me was the interaction I've with the management, specifically Pamela Herzer. After every email I sent, I've received a quick and sincere response. Her willingness to help and serve with no strings attached was almost shocking as it rarely exists these days. You better believe I am referring the Manzanita Cottages to friends and family! I can't wait to stay here! *please note that my rating on service is based on my experience. Bc I had to rate the other

Summary Heading: Perfect stay...thank you for the 2nd chance!
Summary: We attempted to stay at the cottages back in October 2010 and after making reservations and confirming them over and over, we still arrived to find our cottage occupied with another guest! I wrote a less than positive review on Tripadvisor and the owner was very apologetic and offered a complimentary weekends stay should we want to come back. I was very pleased when he still honored this over a year later and we just stayed in the Yellow cottage for our 5th anniversary and it was everything I imagined it would be. Charming, secluded, peaceful and so much better than a hotel! We discovered the lower patio area and had coffee there every morning. We took advantage of the fully stocked kitchen and grill and made dinner 'home' one night and had our breakfast in and packed lunches

We stayed in this gem of a find for 3 nights this past week.  There are 4 cottages and 1 studio apartment.  It is a step back in time with these restored cottages from the 1920's, on their website you can read the history of the cottages and why they were commissioned.  Interesting note that Joan Crawford was rumored to have spent her honeymoon in the Yellow cottage which is the most popular one.  We stayed in the Green cottage and enjoyed every minute of it.  If I had to think of one negative it would be that we tripped a circuit breaker by plugging in 2 space heaters into the same wall/outlet. We couldn't find the breaker box and had to call Diane the property manager but she told us exactly where it was (in closet hidden behind our clothes) so that was really nothing to

My wife and I stayed in the Green Cottage just after Thanksgiving last year. There is no on-site staff but everything was well communicated up front and we quickly settled in. The cottage was exactly what we were looking for and is in a great, central location. The kitchen was well provisioned, the bed comfortable and the living room with the fireplace and overstuffed couch couldn't have been improved upon.  We really enjoyed our time at Manzanita Cottages and will return soon.

The pictures do not do it justice! The Price so reasonable!I stayed a week in the studio and it was plenty big for a single get away or for a romantic couple. Everything was spotless. Dianne was wonderful and left chocolates and coffees to greet me. So comfortable, So cozy so welcoming and it smelled terrific. So welcoming! The gardens are so beautifully manicured and frame the walk to the wishing well where u can cast a penny for a wish. There are multiple sitting areas on the way to the back gate which leads to the beach and to downtown in only 5 minutes. I didn't want to leave then my flight was cancelled and Dianne was able to arrange for me to stay another night! Part of me is still there. You just gotta stay there!

Summary Heading: Comfortable, casually elegant cottages that are an easy walk to the town and beach.
Summary: We stayed in one of the cottages several years ago and then again in December, 2010.  Each time we loved our cottage and the lovely secluded garden compound.  I read some of the negative reviews and can only guess that as the owner responded, they must have suffered from a bad manager.  Our recent experience was very positive.  We had a cottage (I can't remember which color) that had a small kitchenette, a very comfortable bedroom and livingroom with a fireplace.  The bed was very comfortable and there was a choice in pillows (firmness to soft) and good reading lights. The bedroom closet was quite large and had extra pillows, blankets, a space heater and I think even a crib. Everything was immaculate (I confess that I sometimes refuse to walk barefoot in hotel rooms).    Having

My wife had been to the cottages before and loved them.  I read the reviews and was skeptical.  I am a convert.  What a lovely way to spend a few days.  I am very picky about dust and dirt and had absolutely nothing to complain about.  The place is spic and span and just so darn cozy.  Sitting in front of the gas fireplace was so relaxing since the wide floor to ceiling window made you feel like you were sitting in the garden, but looking at the fire.  The place is so quiet, you would never believe you were just a 5 minute walk from the coast highway.   I can't wait for an excuse to return for another breather.

Summary Heading: Classic cottages here are the only way to go
Summary: I was suprised to find this beautiful garden property in the middle of town but tucked away in a world all its own.  Its like stepping back in a time warp.  The cottages are like nothing I'd ever seen from the 20's/30's don't remember the exact build date but they leave nothing to be desired.  Floor to ceiling windows look out on gorgeous garden landscaping.  If you are looking for a relaxing getway destination look no further.  The town has nice views and restaurants but the cottages made the trip for us.  Would recommend to friends.

Neither my partner nor I had been to Laguna Beach before.  And while the city was different than what we'd expected, the cottages exceeded our every expectation and we wondered why anyone would want to leave their cottage anyway!  When you first pull up , there is a wooden gate in which you park face in.  You have no idea the treat that you are in for, once you open that gate and get off the street.  You open the gates to a secret magic garden with charming little guest cottages all surrounding the enchanted grounds.  We stayed in the Yellow Cottage.  It was immaculate.  Every detail lovingly tended to.  Authentic vintage 1930's touches, all fresh and clean.  Gas fireplace, hard wood floors, authentic large windows we opened up to let the fresh breezes and garden views in by

We stayed (parents and two kids) in the Green Cottage with Grandpa in the efficiency apartment. Both places were really cute and had everything we needed. We were there for Thanksgiving week, had a great time, and plan on going again. We too had problems with the manager (couldn't get any confirmation on our reservation, had no heat during a very cold week in November and she didn't do anything about it, etc.). But the cottages are really nice, the grounds are nice, it was very quiet, walking distance to everything, and we had a great time. With a new manager, I'm sure it is a much better experience. The kitchen in the Green Cottage was small but we even managed a holiday dinner by being a bit creative. It's a great place and I hope people don't stay away because of a problem

Summary Heading: Beautiful and peaceful, will definitely stay again.
Summary: This was my second time visiting the Manzanita Cottages. The rooms are cheerfully and beautifully appointed, the beds quite comfortable, and the courtyard between the cottages with its well kept gardens make it feel like a little oasis. The architecture really gave us a sense of what California must have felt like back in the day. My husband and I enjoyed our days at the Cottages reading in the courtyard, walking to the local shops (7 minute walk to a really great downtown area), frequenting restaurants (the fish tacos at La Sirena Grill were amazing), and playing at the beach. My only additional comment would be that the kitchen was less equipped than I usually prefer, but like I said, there are a bunch of great restaurants within walking distance. Other than that our stay both

I'm still so disappointed I didn't get to stay in my Red Cottage over the weekend (Sept 30th). I spent hours researching just the right place for me and my husband to stay and spend a romantic weekend in Laguna. I read the negative reviews on the Internet about reservation problems but thought surely these had been resolved by now! Imagine my 'anger' when we showed up in the dark after a long day to find someone already occupying our cottage! Just what we had read about!  And Rose could not be contacted! We ended up down the street at the Holiday Inn. The next morning, Rose claimed to have moved us to the Green Cottage which wasn't communicated to us and this cottage was still not cleaned from the previous renters. While Rose offered it to us free for the rest of the weekend we
Manager Response: I am the owner of Manzanita Cottages and am deeply sorry for this and other negative reviews.  We have been in business for ten years and went through a serious rough patch with an ineffective manager.  I am happy to say that she has been replaced and we are totally back in the business of delighting guests during their stay in Laguna.  If you are reading this review and are willing to give us a chance to delight you, go to our website and utilize our online reservation process.  In the comment section let us know that you have seen this comment on Trip Advisor and we will give you a 10% discount on the rental fee.  Thank you for giving us a chance! --Todd Herzer, owner.

Summary: I was in town with my husband for a friend's wedding and bc we're always looking for charming, unique places to stay we booked here. We arrived after a transatlantic flight absolutely exhausted and found the place to be almost deserted and that our cottage did not have air conditioning. I should have checked this before I reserved but we did call the manager to ask if any other cottages had air which none of them do. We were also told it is normally fine bc of coastal breezes - not in July. The room was humid and uncomfortable so I asked for a refund of my deposit and we left. We were lucky enough to find a room at the Inn at Laguna Beach last minute (which was lovely). The real nightmare was after we left as the manager at Manzanita never refunded our money as agreed and then
Manager Response: We strive to ensure all guests an enjoyable and memorable stay. This particular guest reserved the studio apartment for August 2009. This historic property was built in 1927 and as a seaside village, air conditioning was not a necessity.   August 2009  was warm and while we do supply fans in each cottage and apartment, this guest was not happy.  We wanted to ensure her comfort for her visit to Laguna Beach so we assisted in finding alternate accommodations and issued a credit, which is against normal policy.  We certainly hope this guest will visit Laguna Beach and Manzanita  Cottages again.  Sent: 01 August 2009  Subject: Manzanita Cottages of Laguna Beach  We hope you had an enjoyable time in Laguna Beach. We are sorry you chose not to stay with us, but do hope you will be back in the future to experience a cottage.  As you know, our cancellation policy stipulates refunds within 90 days  of arrival date, particularly during our busy summer season.  We have,  however, issued you a refund.  Below is your transaction refund summary:

Summary Heading: Current property manager is a problem
Summary: My husband and I have stayed at the cottages multiple times.  Last year's reservation was a nightmare, finding out only a few days before we'd been moved to the yellow cottage.  Not what we booked.  This year we booked in February for our August trip.  Just days after we paid our deposit we were informed by the property manager she "forgot" about another reservation and the blue cottage wasn't available for one of the 14 nights we booked.  It was the last straw for us, reminiscent of what'd we'd been through the year before.  Emails unanswered and issues throughout the summer attempting to get us to spend one night here and move, etc.  We are sad to say goodbye to our favorite BEAUTIFUL Laguna vacation spot.  The integrity issues were just too much to deal with.  One last thing
Manager Response: I am the owner of Manzanita Cottages and am deeply sorry for this and other negative reviews.  We have been in business for ten years and went through a serious rough patch with an ineffective manager.  I am happy to say that she has been replaced and we are totally back in the business of delighting guests during their stay in Laguna.  If you are reading this review and are willing to give us a chance to delight you, go to our website and utilize our online reservation process.  In the comment section let us know that you have seen this comment on Trip Advisor and we will give you a 10% discount on the rental fee.  Thank you for giving us a chance! --Todd Herzer, owner.

Summary: Quaint cottages hidden in quiet residential area.  Needed to change reservation a couple times, management very helpful.  Recommend for romantic get away.
